GrammarQuiz.Question: I´m not going to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    this behaviour any longer!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I´m not going to   <color=#5bd3de>put up with</color>    this behaviour any longer!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   ¡No voy a tolerar este comportamiento más!

GrammarQuiz.Question: You   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    be tired after all that hard work!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: You   <color=#5bd3de>must</color>    be tired after all that hard work!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   ¡Debes estar cansado despues de todo ese duro trabajo!

GrammarQuiz.Question: I´m doing a law degree-specialising  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    commercial law.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I´m doing a law degree-specialising  <color=#5bd3de>in</color>    commercial law.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Estoy haciendo un ley grado especializado en ley comercial.

GrammarQuiz.Question: You  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a doctor if you  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    harder at school!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: You  <color=#5bd3de>could have been</color>    a doctor if you  <color=#5bd3de>had studied</color>    harder at school!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Tengo dos semanas de vacaciones. ¡No puedo esperar!

GrammarQuiz.Question: I have two  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    holiday. I can't wait!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I have two  <color=#5bd3de>weeks</color>    holiday. I can't wait!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Tengo dos semanas de vacaciones. ¡No puedo esperar!

GrammarQuiz.Question: I´ve been  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a diet, but it´s hard to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    to it.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I´ve been  <color=#5bd3de>on a diet</color>    a diet, but it´s hard to   <color=#5bd3de>stick</color>    to it.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   He estado de dieta, pero es duro seguir con ella.

GrammarQuiz.Question: My phone <color=#5bd3de>______________</color> while we    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    the move.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: My phone rang while we were watching the move.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Mi teléfono sonó cuando estábamos viendo la tele.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I always   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    lots of New Year resolutions, but I can never    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    to them.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I always   <color=#5bd3de>make</color>    lots of New Year resolutions, but I can never    <color=#5bd3de>stick</color>    to them.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Siempre hago muchas promesas de Nuevo Año, pero nunca puedo seguirlas.

GrammarQuiz.Question: We've run out of milk! I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    get some when I go to the shop later.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: We've run out of milk! I    <color=#5bd3de>will</color>        get some when I go to the shop later.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Nos hemos quedado sin leche! Iré a por algo cuando vaya a la tienda después.

GrammarQuiz.Question: You <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a doctor if you    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    harder at school!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: You <color=#5bd3de>could have been</color>    a doctor if you    <color=#5bd3de>had studied</color>    harder at school!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Podrías haber sido doctor si hubieras estudiado más duro en el colegio!

GrammarQuiz.Question: I can't meet you at 10 o'clock tomorrow I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    at that time.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I can't meet you at 10 o'clock tomorrow I will be teaching at that time.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  No puedo quedar contigo mañana a las 10, estaré enseñando en esa hora.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I can meet you at 12 o'clock I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    teaching by then.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I can meet you at 12 o'clock I will have finished teaching by then.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Puedo encontrarme contigo a las 12, habré terminado de enseñar para entonces.

GrammarQuiz.Question: My car    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    at the moment, so I have to walk to work.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: My car is being repaired at the moment, so I have to walk to work.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Mi coche está siendo reparado en este momento, a si que tengo que caminar al trabajo.

GrammarQuiz.Question: When I was a child, I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    live on a farm.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: When I was a child, I used to live on a farm.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Cuando era niño vivía (solía vivir) en una granja.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Do you know that    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   is spelt    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    in American English?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Do you know that theatre is spelt theater in American English?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Mi teléfono sonó cuando estábamos viendo la tele.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I bought    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   a new guitar for Christmas!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I bought myself a new guitar for Christmas!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Me compré una nueva guitarra para Navidad!

GrammarQuiz.Question: Who is responsible    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   this mess?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Who is responsible for this mess?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¿Quién es responsable de este desastre?

GrammarQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   it was rainning, we decided to play football.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Althought it was rainning, we decided to play football.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   A pesar de que estaba lloviendo, decididmos jugar al fútbol.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I have    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   friends coming round for dinner tonight. Do you want to come?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I have a few friends coming round for dinner tonight. Do you want to come?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Tengo unos pocos amigos viniendo esta noche a cenar. ¿Quieres venir?

GrammarQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    like a leaf, Paul slowly opened his eyes.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Shaking like a leaf, Paul slowly opened his eyes.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Temblando como una hoja, Paul lentamente abrió los ojos

GrammarQuiz.Question: Don't worry if it doesn't    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    you can always take it back.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Don't worry if it doesn't fit you can always take it back.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   No te preocupes si no te vale, siempre puedes devolverlo.

GrammarQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   Mount Everest is in    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    Himalayas.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: <color=#5bd3de>-</color>   Mount Everest is in    <color=#5bd3de>the</color>    Himalayas.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   El Monte Everest esta en el Himalayas.

GrammarQuiz.Question: He is going to   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    University in September to study English.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: He is going to - University in September to study English.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Va a ir a la universidad en septiembre a estudiar Inglés

GrammarQuiz.Question: He's got   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    wine.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: He's got some wine.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Tiene vino.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Could you shut the window? I'm    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    cold.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Could you shut the window? I'm some cold.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Podrías cerrar la ventana? Tengo un poco de frío.

GrammarQuiz.Question: She will tell you    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    to the party.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: She will tell you what to bring to the party.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Ella te dirá que traer a la fiesta.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Are you taller than Peter? No. But I'm    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Are you taller than Peter? No. But I'm almost as tall
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   ¿Eres más alto qeu Peter? No Pero soy casi tan alto.

GrammarQuiz.Question: The plane flew    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    the castle.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: The plane flew over the castle.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   El avión voló por encima del castillo.

GrammarQuiz.Question: His new girlfriend is   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    nicer than his last one.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: His new girlfriend is far nicer than his last one.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Su nueva novia es mucho más agradable que la última.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I waited for him    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    eight o'clock
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I waited for him until eight o'clock.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Le esperé hasta las 8.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   early tomorrow.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I will leave early tomorrow..
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Me levantaré pronto mañana.

GrammarQuiz.Question: She went to school    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   three months..
GrammarQuiz.Answer: She went to school for three months..
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Ella fue al colegio tres meses.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I had    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    cut yesterday. What do you think?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I had my hair cut yesterday. What do you think?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Ella fue al colegio tres meses.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I really enjoy the class!    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    students are very nice.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I really enjoy the class! my hair students are very nice.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Disfruto de la clase! Los estudiantes son muy buenos.

GrammarQuiz.Question: We've been waiting for ages! The food    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    be ready by now.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: We've been waiting for ages! The food    <color=#5bd3de>must</color>    be ready by now.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Llevamos esperando años! La comida debería estar preparada ya.

GrammarQuiz.Question: We've run out of milk! I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    get some when I go to the shop later.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: We've run out of milk! I will get some when I go to the shop later.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Nos hemos quedado sin leche! Compráre algo cuando vaya a la tienda depués.

GrammarQuiz.Question: If you    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    go anywhere in the world, where    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    you go?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: If you    <color=#5bd3de>could</color>    go anywhere in the world, where    <color=#5bd3de>would</color>    you go?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Si pudieras ir a cualquier lugar de este mundo, ¿Donde irías?

GrammarQuiz.Question: If his band    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    on tour with The Electrons Jamie    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    in England.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: If his band    <color=#5bd3de>goes</color>    on tour with The Electrons Jamie    <color=#5bd3de>will stay</color>     in England.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Si su banda va en un tur con The Electrons, Jamie se quedará en England.

GrammarQuiz.Question: If Emily    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    to France next year, Carolina   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   her.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: If Emily    <color=#5bd3de>goes</color>    to France next year, Carolina   <color=#5bd3de>might visit</color>   her.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Si Emily va a Francia el próximo año, Carolina podría visitarla.

GrammarQuiz.Question: People    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    if you   <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   loudly in a library.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: People    <color=#5bd3de>might complain</color>    if you   <color=#5bd3de>talk</color>   loudly in a library.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  La gente podría quejarse si hablas alto en una biblioteca.

GrammarQuiz.Question: If I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  for my next exams, I  <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   very well.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: If I    <color=#5bd3de>don't study</color>  for my next exams, I  <color=#5bd3de>won't do</color>   very well.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Si no estudio para mis próximos exámenes, no lo haré muy bien.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I almost    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  catch the train, but I was a few seconds too late.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I almost    <color=#5bd3de>managed to</color>  catch the train, but I was a few seconds too late.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Casi fui capaz de coger el tren, pero llegué unos segundos tarde.

GrammarQuiz.Question: When I was a child, I    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    live on a farm.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: When I was a child, I    <color=#5bd3de>cused to</color>    live on a farm.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Cuando era niño, solía vivir en una granja.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I haven't told my mum    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    !
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I haven't told my mum yet !
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡No se lo he contado a mi madre todavía!

GrammarQuiz.Question: This pizza is    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    delicius!
GrammarQuiz.Answer: This pizza is absolutely delicius!
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Esta pizza está absolutamente deliciosa!

GrammarQuiz.Question: Peter is playing tennis    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   Sunday.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Peter is playing tennis on Sunday.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Peter juega tenis el domingo.

GrammarQuiz.Question: My brother's birthday is    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   the 5th of November.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: My brother's birthday is on the 5th of November.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - El cumpleaños de mi hermano es el 5 de noviembre.

GrammarQuiz.Question: My birthday is    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   May.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: My birthday is in May.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Mi cumpleaños es en Mayo.

GrammarQuiz.Question: We are going to see my parents    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   the weekend.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: We are going to see my parents at the weekend.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Vamos a ver a mis padres el fin de semana.

GrammarQuiz.Question: <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   1666, a great fire broke out in London.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: In 1666, a great fire broke out in London.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - En 1666, un gran incendio explotó en Londres.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I don't like walking alone in the streets    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  night.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I don't like walking alone in the streets at night.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - No me gusta caminar sola por las calles de noche.

GrammarQuiz.Question: What are you doing    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  the afternoon?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: What are you doing in the afternoon?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - ¿Que haces por la tarde?

GrammarQuiz.Question: My friend has been living in Canada    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>  two years.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: My friend has been living in Canada for two years.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Mi amigo lleva viviendo en Canada 2 años.

GrammarQuiz.Question: John worked hard and    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    his best at his job, but he still wasn't promoted.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: John worked hard and did his best at his job, but he still wasn't promoted.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   John trabajó duro y dio lo mejor de si mismo, pero aún no ha sido ascendido.

GrammarQuiz.Question: The teenagers were    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    such a noise that the neighbour called the police.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: The teenagers were making such a noise that the neighbour called the police.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Los adolescentens estaban haciendo tanto ruido que los vecinos llamaron a la policía.

GrammarQuiz.Question: She    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a payment on her debt every month. Soon she'll have finished paying it off.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: She makes a payment on her debt every month. Soon she'll have finished paying it off.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -   Ella hace un pago de sus deudas todos los meses. Pronto habrá acabado de pagar todas.

GrammarQuiz.Question: So many chores to     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    ! I need to clean the bathroom and the kitchen, hoover and change all the beds.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: So many chores to do ! I need to clean the bathroom and the kitchen, hoover and change all the beds.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  ¡Tantas tareas que hacer! Tengo que limpiar el baño y la cocina, aspirar y cambiar todas las camas.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Sorry, I've     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a mistake. The restaurant isn't here, but on another street.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Sorry, I've made a mistake. The restaurant isn't here, but on another street.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Lo siento me he confundido un error. El restaurante no está aqui, si no en otra calle.

GrammarQuiz.Question: It's late, and we should go home. Let's     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    a move.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: It's late, and we should go home. Let's make a move.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -  Es tarde, deberíamos ir a casa.  Movámonos.

GrammarQuiz.Question: He     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   a promise to his grandmother that he'd never fight anyone ever again.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: He made a promise to his grandmother that he'd never fight anyone ever again.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Le Hizo una promesa a su abuela de que nunca lucharía contra nadie otra vez.

GrammarQuiz.Question: I called the hotel and     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   a reservation for two people for Saturday the 16th.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: I called the hotel and made a reservation for two people for Saturday the 16th.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: - Llamé al hotel e hize una reserva para dos personas para el Sábado 16.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Could you lend me 20€ for lunch? I'll     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   tomorrow.
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Could you lend me 20€ for lunch? I'll pay you back tomorrow.
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -¿Podrías prestarme 20€ para comer? Te lo devloveré mañana.

GrammarQuiz.Question: Do you know that     <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>   is spelt    <color=#5bd3de>______________</color>    in American English?
GrammarQuiz.Answer: Do you know that     <color=#5bd3de>litre</color>   is spelt    <color=#5bd3de>liter</color>    in American English?
GrammarQuiz.Translation: -¿Sabías que litro se deletrea litro en Inglés Americano?
